column4: my gdm got completely stuck, is there any way to restart the gdm, without restarting the whole computer again?
Generally:  sudo service gdm restart
Just be advised to save whatever it is you're working on currently.
let's see if that works, i already tried /etc/init.d/gdm restart, and nothing happened on the computer
Hmm...strange it didn't do anything from *that* directory.  Did you sudo?
i'm currently using it remotely, but the actual computer showed no changes from earlier restart
yeah, of course i used sudo
Well, I'm not famliar with remote practices.   It could be a permissions issue.  This your box?
yeah, my local home box, currently 5 meters away from my laptop
heh
I see
Well, you could just log out, restart the x server from the gui login page, then log back in.
i can connect to it via SSH, but nothing happens on the screen and the keyboard lights don't react to anything
Sounds like the remote proggie is acting up.
Or ssh is not behaving
absolutely nothing happens on the local machine
Well, then log in to it directly.  Although, I surmise that operating *remotely* is part of your *desired* practice at this moment?
i'm currently logged in to my computer with SSH, but on the monitor and keyboard physically connected to it, nothing happens
That's weird....module loading problem?
i can't login directly, because nothing happens on the screen, gdm got stuck, using keyboard does absolutely nothing
but the computer is still operating on OS level, as i can connect to it remotely
Well, as a test, I'd reboot it, making sure that *nothing* else is connected to it.  I'd even disconnect it from the 'net if it is, just to see if the monitor and keyboard can be detected as-is.
Also, disconnect and reconnect the keyboard and monitor.  Sometimes jacks get dusty.
Blow into the jacks to dislodge dust, if any.  Use pure air in a can if you have it.
